metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20041 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
wp_kses_bad_protocol in wp-includes/kses.php in WordPress before 5.3.1 mishandles the HTML5 colon named entity, allowing attackers to bypass input sanitization, as demonstrated by the javascript: substring.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-20041` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 5.3.2+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 5.3.2+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 5.3.2+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 5.3.2+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 5.3.2+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.3.2+dfsg1-1').
